article.title: Properties of B4C in the shocked state for pressures up to 1.5 TPa

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 1A, what is the pressure (approximately) at which the density of B11C(CBC) on the Hugoniot deviates from that of phase segregated boron and carbon?
choices: 10 GPa
20 GPa
50 GPa
100 GPa

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 1B, what is the approximate temperature on the Hugoniot of B12(CCC) at 100 GPa?
Figure 1C shows a discontinuity in the Hugoniot of the segregated B/C mixture at approximately 20 GPa. What causes this discontinuity?
choices: B11Cp(CBC) becomes thermodynamically unstable
Boron transitions from the α to the γ phase
Boron transitions from the γ to the α-Ga phase
Carbon transitions from graphite to diamond

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2B shows the predicted melting curves for two polytypes of B4C. What interesting behavior do both curves exhibit up to at least 50 GPa?
choices: A positive slope of melting with respect to pressure
A constant melting temperature regardless of pressure
A negative slope of melting with respect to pressure
A sharp increase in melting temperature at high pressures

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3C compares the calculated liquid state Hugoniot of B4C to experimental data. What is the general trend of the experimental Hugoniot at higher pressures compared to the calculated one?
choices: The experimental Hugoniot is significantly harder.
The experimental Hugoniot is slightly softer.
The experimental and calculated Hugoniots are identical.
The experimental Hugoniot shows a sharp discontinuity.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 compares the sound speed at the shock state calculated from FPMD simulations to experimental data. What is the overall agreement between the theoretical and experimental values?
choices: Poor agreement, with significant deviations at all pressures
Good agreement at lower pressures, but deviating at higher pressures
Good agreement at higher pressures, but deviating at lower pressures
Excellent agreement across all considered pressures

multiple_choice_question.text: The Grüneisen parameter (Γ) is shown in Figure 5.  What is the maximum value of  calculated from the FPMD simulations, and at approximately what pressure does it occur?
choices: Γ ≈ 0.7 at 1000 GPa
Γ ≈ 1.4 at 500 GPa
Γ ≈ 2.1 at 1500 GPa
Γ ≈ 2.8 at 250 GPa

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 6A shows the radial distribution functions, g(r), of liquid B4C. What does the behavior of g(r) suggest about the structural ordering in the liquid at pressures lower than 438 GPa?
choices: The liquid exhibits only short-range order.
The liquid exhibits both short- and mid-range order.
The liquid exhibits long-range order similar to a crystal.
The liquid is completely disordered, lacking any structural correlations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What computational method was used to determine the solid state Hugoniot equation of states for the B11Cp(CBC) and B12(CCC) polytypes of boron carbide?
choices: First-principles molecular dynamics (FPMD)
Quasi-harmonic approximation
Density functional theory (DFT) only
Monte Carlo simulations

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on the analysis of radial distribution functions, bond auto-correlation functions, and diffusivity constants, what type of transition is suggested to occur in liquid B4C near 438 GPa (7,683 K)?
choices: A solid-liquid phase transition
A liquid-liquid phase transition
A structural phase transition within the solid state
A decomposition into elemental boron and carbon
